title: How to Make a Spicy Grilled Cheese Sandwich

steps.headline: Per sandwich, make sure you have two layers of cheese and one of pepperoni, with optional scallions on the top layer.
Now that you've measured all your ingredients for fitting into the sandwich, separate those ingredients out into piles on a cutting board.
Turn on your griddle to medium heat.
With both pieces of bread lying on the cutting board, spread half of your butter on one piece, and the other half on the other piece.
When the griddle seems hot enough (test it by placing your hand just above it) put one piece of bread down, buttered side on the griddle.
Grab a potholder and carefully, add all the piled ingredients onto the bread.
steps.description: When it seems organized, add the second piece of bread on BUTTER SIDE UP to the top!

steps.headline: Now, compress your entire sandwich with the spatula.
steps.description: This should make it sizzle, and will keep all of the ingredients together. Don't do this for too long or it will burn. make sure your spatula isn't picking off too much butter from the top, lack of butter makes the bread burn.

steps.headline: Occasionally check the bottom piece with your pot holders and spatula.
steps.description: Use your best judgment. As long as all of the butter is gone, and the sandwich is crispy enough for your taste, you can move on to the next step.

steps.headline: Carefully, with your spatula and pot holders flip the sandwich over.
steps.description: Now is your chance to really compress it without any butter sticking. Remember that the 2nd side usually cooks faster, but use the same process as step 11.

steps.headline: When the sandwich seems satisfactory, take it off the griddle and serve immediately.

text: Gather your materials and ingredients.  Per sandwich, make sure you have two layers of cheese and one of pepperoni, with optional scallions on the top layer.  Now that you've measured all your ingredients for fitting into the sandwich, separate those ingredients out into piles on a cutting board.  Turn on your griddle to medium heat.  With both pieces of bread lying on the cutting board, spread half of your butter on one piece, and the other half on the other piece.  When the griddle seems hot enough (test it by placing your hand just above it) put one piece of bread down, buttered side on the griddle.  Grab a potholder and carefully, add all the piled ingredients onto the bread. When it seems organized, add the second piece of bread on BUTTER SIDE UP to the top! Now, compress your entire sandwich with the spatula. This should make it sizzle, and will keep all of the ingredients together. Don't do this for too long or it will burn. make sure your spatula isn't picking off too much butter from the top, lack of butter makes the bread burn. Occasionally check the bottom piece with your pot holders and spatula. Use your best judgment. As long as all of the butter is gone, and the sandwich is crispy enough for your taste, you can move on to the next step. Carefully, with your spatula and pot holders flip the sandwich over. Now is your chance to really compress it without any butter sticking. Remember that the 2nd side usually cooks faster, but use the same process as step 11. When the sandwich seems satisfactory, take it off the griddle and serve immediately. Make sure the griddle gets turned off. Serve with your favorite chips and soda. This adds to the overall spice of the dish.
